image.altText: Trees and a car roof poking out from muddy flooded river

props.synopsis: Residents in parts of the NSW Mid North Coast are urged to evacuate their homes due to locally intense rain. Follow live.

title.children: 'Incredible' rainfalls as parts of NSW record well over 200mm

image.altText: Aerial view of flooded roads and bridges in a country area.

props.synopsis: Heavy rain continues to batter parts of NSW, leading to residents being forced to leave their homes and numerous flood rescues.

title.children: Evacuations and major flood warnings amid torrential rain in NSW

image.altText: Michele Bullock, looking at journalists, wearing a light blazer, standing at a podium, during a press conference

props.synopsis: As the Reserve Bank is tipped to deliver its second rate cut this cycle, the greatest uncertainty overhanging the world economy is America, once the bedrock of global financial stability.

title.children: Economic storm brewing largely outside Michele Bullock's control

image.altText: Sussan Ley, David Littleproud, Angus Taylor, Peter Dutton QT 20221027_041653670_iOS

props.synopsis: Nuclear energy, regional funding and forced divestiture of supermarkets are proving to be key policy sticking points in negotiations between the Liberals and Nationals. Follow live.

title.children: Nationals consider split as Coalition negotiations continue

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: We're standing by for a Nationals leader press conference
Tasmania demands Albanese govt step in and support troubled smelter
Canavan not 'wedded' to keeping nuclear policy

image.altText: Joe and Jill Biden posing for a selfie with their cat

props.synopsis: Former US president Joe Biden makes his first public remarks about his cancer diagnosis, thanking supporters for lifting him and his family up.

title.children: 'Strongest in the broken places': Biden thanks supporters after diagnosis

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: The triple murder trial of Erin Patterson continues in the Latrobe Valley Law Courts in Morwell. She's accused of murdering three relatives by serving them a meal that contained death cap mushrooms. Follow the trial live.

title.children: Phone records back in spotlight as Erin Patterson's murder trial continues

image.altText: Dozens of people squash one another reaching forward with bowls looking desperate for them to be filled with food

props.synopsis: Israeli authorities start letting small amounts of aid in the war-ravaged strip, conceding some supplies such as baby food are running low in Gaza.

title.children: Five aid trucks enter Gaza after months-long humanitarian blockade

image.altText: Reserve Bank sign overlaid with inflation chart

props.synopsis: Some relief is in sight for home loan borrowers, with the Reserve Bank to deliver its interest rates decision at 2:30pm AEST. Economist forecasts and financial markets are strongly pointing to a 0.25 percentage point cut. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: RBA interest rate cut considered a near certainty

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: RBA expected to deliver interest rate cut at 2:30pm AEST
What's happening on the markets this morning?
ASX on the rise at the open

image.altText: Donald Trump stands at a podium and points straight ahead.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin was trained in the KGB world of working out the psychology of your opponent, so it is not surprising he is outfoxing Donald Trump. The US president is now talking about walking away from peace talks.

title.children: Played by Putin, a 'weary' Trump could walk away from Ukraine

image.altText: a man walks between rows of servers

props.synopsis: Data centres whirr away, critical to so much of our daily lives, yet they don't often make the headlines. But that is starting to change.

title.children: Inside the nondescript concrete cubes that keep the world online

image.altText: Anthea standing next to a woman whose face is blurred. Both are wearing diving gear

props.synopsis: The ABC has uncovered allegations of two more incidents where Perth Diving Academy customers were rescued by passing boats after drifting away from their dive boat, claims the company disputes.

title.children: More allegations surface about dive company that left men behind in water

image.altText: Large billboard of man with politcal slogans

props.synopsis: Queensland parliament is expected to pass the second tranche of "adult crime, adult time" laws this week, which will see a further 20 offences added to the bill.

title.children: 'A new underclass': UN criticises adult crime, adult time laws

image.altText: Police comb the scene on Dalton Ave, Condell Park

props.synopsis: A man in his early 20s is believed to be the 29th fatality in Sydney's gangland war, with detectives saying he had no criminal links before being shot 10 times on the driveway of the family home on Monday night.

title.children: Cleanskin plumber, 23, dead after 'violent execution-style killing'

image.altText: Queensland Maroons State of Origin coach Billy Slater sits at a microphone.

props.synopsis: As Billy Slater prepares to coach in his fourth straight State of Origin series, he's already done what 23 others couldn't, but this may be his toughest challenge yet.

title.children: Already one of just six, Slater's Origin career reaches an intriguing point

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a suit shaking the pope's hand in a room in the Vatican.

props.synopsis: It is the first time an Australian prime minister has had a private audience with the head of the Catholic Church since 2008.

title.children: Albanese formally invites Pope Leo to Australia at Vatican meeting

image.altText: Cyndi holding her son upside-down in front of a purple mural

props.synopsis: Australians are increasingly accessing their superannuation early to fund IVF treatment. The involvement of fertility clinics has some experts concerned.

title.children: How much is using superannuation to pay for IVF really costing women?

image.altText: A woman puts her hands together in thanks as she smiles looking out of a car window

props.synopsis: From a Jakarta prison cell to prime-time Australian television in a matter of months, Jessica Wongso is fighting to have her murder conviction overturned.

title.children: 'Iced coffee killer' denies being close friends with victim

image.altText: A court sketch of Sean Combs speaking with his lawyer.

props.synopsis: Dawn Richard says Sean "Diddy" Combs told her she could "go missing" if she spoke up about him beating his then-girlfriend Casandra Ventura.

title.children: Pop singer testifies Sean 'Diddy' Combs threatened her after witnessing assault

image.altText: Woman stands with skis in black and white photo on skifield.

props.synopsis: Dorothy Jean Vaillancourt moved to the United States for love. Decades later she has been identified as a Jane Doe whose body was found in California in 1966, leaving her relatives searching for answers.

title.children: DNA solved mystery of Australian-born Jane Doe found on Californian cliff

image.altText: Jack Doohan of Australia and Alpine F1 walks in the Pitlane during Sprint qualifying ahead of the F1 Grand Prix of Miami

props.synopsis: Australian F1 driver Jack Doohan has made a plea for the online abuse of his family to stop, following the circulation of a post from an account falsely portraying his father.

title.children: 'Stop harassing my family': Doohan's plea after abuse over fake photo

image.altText: Polly sits on a tree branch with a bush landscape in the background.

props.synopsis: Traditional landowner Polly Cutmore says a decision by the National Native Title Tribunal to allow the New South Wales government to lease land to Santos for gas extraction is devastating.

title.children: Tribunal rules NSW government can lease culturally significant land to Santos

image.altText: Keir Starmer addressing a press conference in an ornate ballroom, with Ursula von der Leyen in the background.

props.synopsis: The deal will open up the UK to billions of euros in defence financing, but has been criticised by the British opposition as backtracking on Brexit.

title.children: UK and EU announce first major economic and military deal since Brexit

image.altText: Athletes and Thomas Bach

props.synopsis: International Olympic Committee (IOC) executives will meet in Brisbane from today with organisers for the 2032 Games as preparations ramp up.

title.children: Olympic executives visit Brisbane for in-country meeting ahead of Games

image.altText: Three individuals wearing casual outdoor clothing photographed from the shoulders up.

props.synopsis: Liberty Bell Bay employs more than 250 full-time workers, mostly from the George Town area. Locals say they are worried about the impact of job losses as the smelter announces it's limiting operations.

title.children: Locals fear for jobs after Liberty Bell Bay limits operations

image.altText: Man holding a mobile phone

props.synopsis: Rural residents and small businesses are lodging complaints about their mobile phones dropping out and poor internet services, figures from the Telecommunications Ombudsman show.

title.children: Ombudsman warns of 'life-threatening situations' after 3G shutdown

image.altText: A police man smiling surrounded by dry bushland.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the suicide of Northern Territory Constable Michael Deutrom is set to examine the challenges faced by police officers and whether more can be done to support those on the frontline.

title.children: Inquest to examine NT police officer's suicide after 23 years on frontline

image.altText: A large tank driving through a cloud of dust.

props.synopsis: The IDF says it is preparing to launch an "unprecedented attack" against Hamas in the area.

title.children: Israel issues evacuation warning ahead of 'unprecedented attack' in south Gaza

image.altText: A fire truck bearing a hand-painted sign reading "Go Fight Your Own Fires Jacinta Allan".

props.synopsis: Volunteer firefighters and farmers say the Victorian government's new tax is "totally unfair" and will send communities to the wall. As the budget looms, they are in the state capital to raise their voices.

title.children: Calls for Vic premier to 'hold a hose' as firies rage against new levy

image.altText: A bee crawling out of a hole in a timber structure

props.synopsis: A bee hotel is a great way to attract native bees to your backyard, but experts say some pre-made models are unsuitable and can even harm their guests.

title.children: Warning pre-made bee hotels could be harming native species

image.altText: A lady in pink standing in a dry, empty dam on her property

props.synopsis: Record numbers of sheep and cattle are being sold at saleyards in southern New South Wales as the region's drought continues.

title.children: Dams empty, farmers sell livestock as southern NSW dries out

image.altText: Gary Lineker

props.synopsis: Soccer legend Gary Lineker apologises for sharing a post about Zionism with a picture of a rat, and will step down from the BBC at the end of the EPL season.

title.children: 'Genuine mistake': Lineker to leave the BBC after sharing Zionism post

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou claps his hands after a Tottenham win in the Premier League.

props.synopsis: Tottenham legend Micky Hazard says Ange Postecoglou should get the chance to continue with Tottenham should he lead Spurs to victory over Manchester United in the Europa League final.

title.children: Postecoglou should stay if he wins Europa League, says Tottenham legend

image.altText: Two men stand in a storeroom, one hanging upside down with his mouth open, the other holding his shoulder and wincing

props.synopsis: After starring in the first Thai film ever shortlisted for an Oscar, actor and singer Billkin leads the way in a story that starts like a rom-com, turns into a quirky buddy comedy bromance and still manages to tug at the heartstrings.

title.children: A homophobic man has to marry a gay ghost in this deeply silly Thai rom-com

image.altText: A dual occupancy home with a white mailbox that has two openings that read "A" and "B".

props.synopsis: The ACT government proposes changes to planning rules so more "missing middle" housing like townhouses and duplexes can be built.

title.children: Building a second dwelling on a residential Canberra block could soon be easier

image.altText: Georgiana Darcy and Elizabeth Bennett seated at the piano in the 1995 BBC show Pride and Prejudice

props.synopsis: The piano has been the star of the screen since before movies had sound. From Big to Amadeus, we look at some of the most iconic moments of the piano on screen.

title.children: The piano has always been important on screen. Here are 10 times it stole the show
